00168 typedef enum {
00169         /* This is a new object to be allocated, or the file
00170          * corresponding to the object does not exists. */
00171         LOC_F_NEW       = 0x00000001,
00172 
00173         /* When find a dying object, just return -EAGAIN at once instead of
00174          * blocking the thread. */
00175         LOC_F_NOWAIT    = 0x00000002,
00176 } loc_flags_t;

00399 static inline int lu_device_is_md(const struct lu_device *d)
00400 {

00652 static inline struct lu_site_bkt_data *
00653 lu_site_bkt_from_fid(struct lu_site *site, struct lu_fid *fid)
00654 {
00655         struct cfs_hash_bd bd;
00656 
00657         cfs_hash_bd_get(site->ls_obj_hash, fid, &bd);
00658         return cfs_hash_bd_extra_get(site->ls_obj_hash, &bd);
00659 }

00709 static inline void lu_object_get(struct lu_object *o)
00710 {
00711         LASSERT(atomic_read(&o->lo_header->loh_ref) > 0);
00712         atomic_inc(&o->lo_header->loh_ref);
00713 }
00714 
00719 static inline int lu_object_is_dying(const struct lu_object_header *h)
00720 {
00721         return test_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE, &h->loh_flags);
00722 }

00753 static inline struct lu_object *lu_object_top(struct lu_object_header *h)
00754 {
00755         LASSERT(!list_empty(&h->loh_layers));
00756         return container_of0(h->loh_layers.next, struct lu_object, lo_linkage);
00757 }
00758 
00762 static inline struct lu_object *lu_object_next(const struct lu_object *o)
00763 {
00764         return container_of0(o->lo_linkage.next, struct lu_object, lo_linkage);
00765 }

00771 {
00772         return &o->lo_header->loh_fid;
00773 }

00794 int lu_cdebug_printer(const struct lu_env *env,
00795                       void *cookie, const char *format, ...);
00796 
00800 #define LU_OBJECT_DEBUG(mask, env, object, format, ...)                   \
00801 do {                                                                      \
00802         if (cfs_cdebug_show(mask, DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM)) {                     \
00803                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, mask, NULL);          \
00804                 lu_object_print(env, &msgdata, lu_cdebug_printer, object);\
00805                 CDEBUG(mask, format "\n", ## __VA_ARGS__);                \
00806         }                                                                 \
00807 } while (0)
00808 
00812 #define LU_OBJECT_HEADER(mask, env, object, format, ...)                \
00813 do {                                                                    \
00814         if (cfs_cdebug_show(mask, DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM)) {                   \
00815                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, mask, NULL);        \
00816                 lu_object_header_print(env, &msgdata, lu_cdebug_printer,\
00817                                        (object)->lo_header);            \
00818                 lu_cdebug_printer(env, &msgdata, "\n");                 \
00819                 CDEBUG(mask, format , ## __VA_ARGS__);                  \
00820         }                                                               \
00821 } while (0)
00822

00825 void lu_object_header_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00826                             lu_printer_t printer,
00827                             const struct lu_object_header *hdr);

00840 #define lu_object_exists(o) ((o)->lo_header->loh_attr & LOHA_EXISTS)
00841 
00845 #define lu_object_remote(o) unlikely((o)->lo_header->loh_attr & LOHA_REMOTE)
00846 
00847 static inline int lu_object_assert_exists(const struct lu_object *o)
00848 {
00849         return lu_object_exists(o);
00850 }
00851 
00852 static inline int lu_object_assert_not_exists(const struct lu_object *o)
00853 {
00854         return !lu_object_exists(o);
00855 }
00856 
00860 static inline __u32 lu_object_attr(const struct lu_object *o)
00861 {
00862         LASSERT(lu_object_exists(o) != 0);
00863         return o->lo_header->loh_attr;
00864 }

00991 enum lu_context_tag {
00995         LCT_MD_THREAD = 1 << 0,
00999         LCT_DT_THREAD = 1 << 1,
01003         LCT_TX_HANDLE = 1 << 2,
01007         LCT_CL_THREAD = 1 << 3,
01012         LCT_SESSION   = 1 << 4,
01016         LCT_OSP_THREAD = 1 << 5,
01020         LCT_MG_THREAD = 1 << 6,
01024         LCT_LOCAL = 1 << 7,
01028         LCT_SERVER_SESSION = 1 << 8,
01034         LCT_HAS_EXIT  = 1 << 28,
01039         LCT_NOREF     = 1 << 29,
01043         LCT_QUIESCENT = 1 << 30,
01047         LCT_REMEMBER  = 1 << 31,
01051         LCT_SHRINKER  = LCT_MD_THREAD|LCT_DT_THREAD|LCT_CL_THREAD|LCT_NOREF
01052 };

01090 struct lu_context_key {
01094         __u32 lct_tags;
01099         void  *(*lct_init)(const struct lu_context *ctx,
01100                            struct lu_context_key *key);
01106         void   (*lct_fini)(const struct lu_context *ctx,
01107                            struct lu_context_key *key, void *data);
01113         void   (*lct_exit)(const struct lu_context *ctx,
01114                            struct lu_context_key *key, void *data);
01119         int             lct_index;
01124         atomic_t        lct_used;
01128         struct module   *lct_owner;
01132         struct lu_ref   lct_reference;
01133 };
01134 
01135 #define LU_KEY_INIT(mod, type)                                    \
01136         static void* mod##_key_init(const struct lu_context *ctx, \
01137                                     struct lu_context_key *key)   \
01138         {                                                         \
01139                 type *value;                                      \
01140                                                                   \
01141                 CLASSERT(PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >= sizeof (*value));       \
01142                                                                   \
01143                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(value);                             \
01144                 if (value == NULL)                                \
01145                         value = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);                 \
01146                                                                   \
01147                 return value;                                     \
01148         }                                                         \
01149         struct __##mod##__dummy_init {;} /* semicolon catcher */
01150 
01151 #define LU_KEY_FINI(mod, type)                                              \
01152         static void mod##_key_fini(const struct lu_context *ctx,            \
01153                                     struct lu_context_key *key, void* data) \
01154         {                                                                   \
01155                 type *info = data;                                          \
01156                                                                             \
01157                 OBD_FREE_PTR(info);                                         \
01158         }                                                                   \
01159         struct __##mod##__dummy_fini {;} /* semicolon catcher */
01160 
01161 #define LU_KEY_INIT_FINI(mod, type)   \
01162         LU_KEY_INIT(mod,type);        \
01163         LU_KEY_FINI(mod,type)
01164 
01165 #define LU_CONTEXT_KEY_DEFINE(mod, tags)                \
01166         struct lu_context_key mod##_thread_key = {      \
01167                 .lct_tags = tags,                       \
01168                 .lct_init = mod##_key_init,             \
01169                 .lct_fini = mod##_key_fini              \
01170         }
01171 
01172 #define LU_CONTEXT_KEY_INIT(key)                        \
01173 do {                                                    \
01174         (key)->lct_owner = THIS_MODULE;                 \
01175 } while (0)
01176 
01177 int   lu_context_key_register(struct lu_context_key *key);
01178 void  lu_context_key_degister(struct lu_context_key *key);
01179 void *lu_context_key_get     (const struct lu_context *ctx,
01180                                const struct lu_context_key *key);
01181 void  lu_context_key_quiesce (struct lu_context_key *key);
01182 void  lu_context_key_revive  (struct lu_context_key *key);
01183 
01184 
01185 /*
01186  * LU_KEY_INIT_GENERIC() has to be a macro to correctly determine an
01187  * owning module.
01188  */
01189 
01190 #define LU_KEY_INIT_GENERIC(mod)                                        \
01191         static void mod##_key_init_generic(struct lu_context_key *k, ...) \
01192         {                                                               \
01193                 struct lu_context_key *key = k;                         \
01194                 va_list args;                                           \
01195                                                                         \
01196                 va_start(args, k);                                      \
01197                 do {                                                    \
01198                         LU_CONTEXT_KEY_INIT(key);                       \
01199                         key = va_arg(args, struct lu_context_key *);    \
01200                 } while (key != NULL);                                  \
01201                 va_end(args);                                           \
01202         }
01203 
01204 #define LU_TYPE_INIT(mod, ...)                                          \
01205         LU_KEY_INIT_GENERIC(mod)                                        \
01206         static int mod##_type_init(struct lu_device_type *t)            \
01207         {                                                               \
01208                 mod##_key_init_generic(__VA_ARGS__, NULL);              \
01209                 return lu_context_key_register_many(__VA_ARGS__, NULL); \
01210         }                                                               \
01211         struct __##mod##_dummy_type_init {;}
01212 
01213 #define LU_TYPE_FINI(mod, ...)                                          \
01214         static void mod##_type_fini(struct lu_device_type *t)           \
01215         {                                                               \
01216                 lu_context_key_degister_many(__VA_ARGS__, NULL);        \
01217         }                                                               \
01218         struct __##mod##_dummy_type_fini {;}
01219 
01220 #define LU_TYPE_START(mod, ...)                                 \
01221         static void mod##_type_start(struct lu_device_type *t)  \
01222         {                                                       \
01223                 lu_context_key_revive_many(__VA_ARGS__, NULL);  \
01224         }                                                       \
01225         struct __##mod##_dummy_type_start {;}
01226 
01227 #define LU_TYPE_STOP(mod, ...)                                  \
01228         static void mod##_type_stop(struct lu_device_type *t)   \
01229         {                                                       \
01230                 lu_context_key_quiesce_many(__VA_ARGS__, NULL); \
01231         }                                                       \
01232         struct __##mod##_dummy_type_stop {;}
01233 
01234 
01235 
01236 #define LU_TYPE_INIT_FINI(mod, ...)             \
01237         LU_TYPE_INIT(mod, __VA_ARGS__);         \
01238         LU_TYPE_FINI(mod, __VA_ARGS__);         \
01239         LU_TYPE_START(mod, __VA_ARGS__);        \
01240         LU_TYPE_STOP(mod, __VA_ARGS__)
01241 
01242 int   lu_context_init  (struct lu_context *ctx, __u32 tags);
01243 void  lu_context_fini  (struct lu_context *ctx);
01244 void  lu_context_enter (struct lu_context *ctx);
01245 void  lu_context_exit  (struct lu_context *ctx);
01246 int   lu_context_refill(struct lu_context *ctx);
01247 
01248 /*
01249  * Helper functions to operate on multiple keys. These are used by the default
01250  * device type operations, defined by LU_TYPE_INIT_FINI().
01251  */
01252 
01253 int  lu_context_key_register_many(struct lu_context_key *k, ...);
01254 void lu_context_key_degister_many(struct lu_context_key *k, ...);
01255 void lu_context_key_revive_many  (struct lu_context_key *k, ...);
01256 void lu_context_key_quiesce_many (struct lu_context_key *k, ...);
01257

01260  */

01291 int lu_site_stats_seq_print(const struct lu_site *s, struct seq_file *m);
01292 
01296 struct lu_name {
01297         const char    *ln_name;
01298         int            ln_namelen;
01299 };
01300 
01310 static inline bool lu_name_is_valid_2(const char *name, size_t name_len)
01311 {
01312         return name != NULL &&
01313                name_len > 0 &&
01314                name_len < INT_MAX &&
01315                name[name_len] == '\0' &&
01316                strlen(name) == name_len &&
01317                memchr(name, '/', name_len) == NULL;
01318 }
01319 
01320 static inline bool lu_name_is_valid(const struct lu_name *ln)
01321 {
01322         return lu_name_is_valid_2(ln->ln_name, ln->ln_namelen);
01323 }
01324 
01325 #define DNAME "%.*s"
01326 #define PNAME(ln)                                       \
01327         (lu_name_is_valid(ln) ? (ln)->ln_namelen : 0),  \
01328         (lu_name_is_valid(ln) ? (ln)->ln_name : "")
01329

01393 static inline bool lu_device_is_cl(const struct lu_device *d)
01394 {
01395         return d->ld_type->ldt_tags & LU_DEVICE_CL;
01396 }
01397 
01398 static inline bool lu_object_is_cl(const struct lu_object *o)
01399 {
01400         return lu_device_is_cl(o->lo_dev);
